p: The common juniper ( Juniperus communis L.) is a multistemmed shrub or small tree, whose seed cones are usually called berries. This is the most widespread conifer in the world, native to temperate Eurasia, North America and northern Mexico, occupying an extraordinary range of habitats [ 62]. Juniper berry oil largely consists of monoterpene hydrocarbons such as 𝛽-pinene, 𝛼-pinene, sabinene, myrcene, and limonene [ 63].
